summary:
The 1948 Arab–Israeli War started as a civil conflict in Palestine under British rule. After Israel declared independence in 1948, Arab countries attacked. The war ended with Israel controlling more land than planned, and many Palestinian Arabs became refugees.

The conflict had roots in tensions between Arabs, Jews, and British rulers. It led to the creation of Israel and the division of Palestine. The consequences included the displacement of Palestinians and the arrival of many Jewish refugees in Israel.
title: 1948 Arab–Israeli War
